page.title: 07Shopping
page.content: Only Frieth possesses facilities for shopping. Most families shop for their groceries and provisions at the super markets in the local towns - Wycombe, Marlow or Henley. Several years ago Frieth had a village stores, and a sub-post office. The post office closed. The Village Stores was modernised and a sub-post office installed. That too closed, but the local dairyman opened a new shop and an extension was built as a sub-post office. The Dairy sells a full range of groceries and provisions and general goods typical of a village shop, as well as a full range of dairy produce supplied by a national dairy. The milk delivery vans are equipped to carry a range of groceries and provisions. The old village shop now sells house furnishings.
